subject: RE: [junit] Re: How to comment test methods in Junit 4?
msgSnippet: Cedric, I don t understand your message. Subclasses of Filter can be defined anywhere. Because they are defined as Java code, the filters can be as complicated
messageBody:
Cedric,

I don't understand your message. Subclasses of Filter can be defined
anywhere. Because they are defined as Java code, the filters can be as
complicated as the users need them to be. Once we (the community) have some
experience with how filters are commonly used, I agree that making filters
more accessible would be helpful.

Sincerely yours,

Kent Beck
Three Rivers Institute

> -----Original Message-----
> From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On
> Behalf Of CÃ©dric Beust ?
> Sent: Friday, June 02, 2006 2:41 PM
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: Re: [junit] Re: How to comment test methods in Junit 4?
>
> Hi Kent,
>
> It seems unfortunate that this filtering support is tied to a
> test class.
